items.title: Queensland's new chief health officer Marianne Gale outlines future priorities
items.summary: Marianne Gale reminisces about her time working for Doctors Without Borders to emphasise how she wants to shape the public health of the state – with a strong focus on equity.

items.title: Nurses' strike at Adelaide's Lyell McEwin Hospital cancelled after pay increase ahead of state election start
items.summary: The Australian Nursing and Midwifery Federation cancels a strike at one of Adelaide's largest public hospitals after securing a 2 per cent pay rise on top of a 4 per cent immediate increase in wages announced earlier this week.

items.title: Man accused of performing Nazi salute at AFL exploring mental health defence
items.summary: Tylere Baker-Pearce, 39, was initially charged with giving the salute at the Gabba, and was later hit with two additional counts of the alleged offence.

items.title: Ellyse Perry's evolution cements greatness as Australian cricket milestone looms
items.summary: Cricket superstar Ellyse Perry will become the first woman to play 350 matches for Australia across all formats on Saturday.

items.title: Port Pirie's toddlers record highest blood lead levels in a decade
items.summary: The percentage of two-year-old children above the blood lead level threshold in Port Pirie is the highest in a decade, according to the latest figures.

items.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on day 14
items.summary: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

items.title: Woman who fatally struck 12-year-old Marshall Oakley-Stagg granted restricted driver's licence
items.summary: A driver who struck and killed a 12-year-old boy outside his school in southern Tasmania in 2024 has been granted a restricted licence.

items.title: WA treasury takes rates from forestry plantations, leaving regional WA shires with funding shortfall
items.summary: Seven South West councils face $325,000 funding shortfall after forestry rate payments redirected to state Treasury. Shires warn residents could face higher rates or cuts to essential services as they push the state government for a solution.

items.title: MotoGP Adelaide move raises concerns about rider safety, transport and trees
items.summary: A rider, a reporter and a road safety expert say it will be difficult to make it safe for motorcycles to race around the Adelaide Parklands.

items.title: Scientists model best-case and worst-case climate scenarios for Antarctica
items.summary: Scientists say parts of Antarctica face "devastating" and "irreversible" impacts from climate change unless urgent action is taken to limit greenhouse gas emissions.

items.title: Kyra Wheatley ready to ride the chaos and speed of ski cross at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
items.summary: The speed and chaos of ski cross is what attracted Kyra Wheatley to the sport, and to realise a dream 12 years in the making of competing at the Winter Olympics.

items.title: Coroner delivers findings into James Tsindos's death from allergic reaction to delivery meal
items.summary: A Victorian coroner hands down her findings into the death of a teenager who suffered a severe allergic reaction to a delivery meal — but it's unclear if more urgent treatment would have saved his life.

items.title: Parents speak at sentencing hearing for Christopher Turner over fatal gas mix-up
items.summary: The parents of two babies given nitrous oxide in a fatal gas mix-up at a Sydney hospital almost a decade ago express their pain and trauma at the sentencing hearing for the man responsible.

items.title: Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage charged with illegal surveillance by WA Police sex crime division
items.summary: Geraldton Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage has been charged with the illegal installation of a surveillance device and unlawful use of a computer by WA sex crime detectives.

items.title: Eileen Gu says JD Vance is 'sweet' for saying she should be competing for US at 2026 Winter Olympics
items.summary: Eileen Gu says she is flattered that JD Vance thinks she should be competing for the US, but feels his comments are driven by an anti-China bias from Washington.

items.title: Complainant in former Liberal MP Rory Amon's underage sexual assault trial addresses court
items.summary: The complainant in the sexual assault trial of former Liberal MP Rory Amon has told a court of the alleged incidents that took place in a car park toilet when he was 13.

items.title: Cameron William Leslie Clark, accused of Easts Leagues Club stabbing, appears in court
items.summary: Cameron William Leslie Clark is accused of repeatedly stabbing a 20-year-old female employee of the Easts Leagues Club in Coorparoo last Thursday night.

items.title: The Board of Peace meant to rebuild Gaza may well end up as another monument to Donald Trump
items.summary: Unless the Board of Peace begins to focus and genuinely tries to make the world a better place, this may well prove to be yet another monument to Donald Trump.

items.title: WA councils could make laws to stop cats roaming under proposed state legislation
items.summary: The WA government announces plans to give local councils the power to require cats to be contained to owners' properties, to protect native birds and other wildlife.

items.title: Eric Dane, star of Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria, dies aged 53
items.summary: The star was best known for his role as Dr Mark Sloan in long-running medical drama Grey's Anatomy, and as the patriarch of the Jacobs family in teen hit Euphoria.

items.title: Commercial fishing licence buybacks recommended in latest harmful algal bloom report
items.summary: Fishing licence buybacks and long-term restocking plans are some of the recommendations in the latest report into South Australia's harmful algal bloom, which has been labelled as "vanilla" by one scientist turned political candidate.

items.title: David James Pye found guilty of murdering former Rebels boss Nick Martin after recruiting sniper
items.summary: Bikie David Pye is convicted of murder after he paid a trained sniper to assassinate his former friend and ex-Rebels boss Nick Martin in front of horrified onlookers at a drag racing event.

items.title: Indra Brown's Winter Olympics medal contention doesn't remove the reality of school homework
items.summary: Sixteen-year-old Indra Brown came into the Winter Olympics as one of the top medal contenders in freeski halfpipe — a status elevated since she finished fourth in qualification — but it still doesn't get her out of maths homework.

items.title: Brisbane Broncos lose World Club Challenge to Hull KR 30-24
items.summary: After pulling off three straight comebacks to win the NRL premiership, the Brisbane Broncos fall just short of another miracle against Hull KR in the World Club Challenge.

items.title: NT cattle sector backs draft buffel grass plan as environmental and Aboriginal groups say it favours industry
items.summary: Cattle producers support the NT's draft buffel grass weed management plan, but it has attracted criticism from traditional owners and environmental groups.

items.title: Australian exporters could face windfall if Trump tariffs ruled unlawful by US Supreme Court
items.summary: Modelling by consulting firm EY Australia shows Australian exporters would be owed more than $1.4 billion in refunds collectively if the US tariffs are struck down.

items.title: NT hit-and-run driver Jake Danby's sentence extended on appeal, as victim's family say they feel 'broken'
items.summary: The sentence of NT hit-and-run driver Jake Danby has been extended on appeal, meaning he will serve two years in home detention. Danby hit two pedestrians with his car in June 2024, killing one.

items.title: Is it OK to feed Australia's wild birds?
items.summary: Many of us love interacting with and feeding wild birds, but experts say giving them the wrong types of food can do more harm than good.

items.title: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu set to show world leaders climate change impact ahead of COP31
items.summary: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu look set to host world leaders and climate change ministers in the lead-up to COP31 in a bid to encourage larger countries to accelerate cuts to emissions.

items.title: Winter Olympics 2026: JD Vance laments Eileen Gu's choice and Scotty James channels Wolf of Wall Street — day 13 quick hits
items.summary: Scotty James says he is not done, while Sweden claims the entire curling world is "against us". Here are the quick hits from day 13 at the Winter Olympics.

items.title: Canadian skier Cassie Sharpe's horrific crash in the halfpipe reminds us of Winter Olympics dangers
items.summary: As Cassie Sharpe lay motionless on the base of the Livigno halfpipe, the excruciating tension reminded us all that winter Olympians are only ever seconds from disaster.

items.title: 'Dying' NASA satellite leaves Australia's north waiting hours for latest fire information
items.summary: A NASA satellite used to detect bushfires in real time across two thirds of Australia is "dying" and it could be months before a replacement is online.

items.title: Bangarra Dance Theatre wins Golden Lion at international dance festival Venice Danza 2026
items.summary: Indigenous dance company Bangarra Dance Theatre has become the first company and first First Nations performers to receive the Golden Lion at Venice Danza, the international festival of contemporary dance.

items.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor released under investigation after almost 10 hours in custody
items.summary: The former Duke of York has been released under investigation by British police, as officers continue to search his former Windsor home.

items.title: Sam Altman and Dario Amodei refuse to hold hands
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Ingham abuzz as recovering sugar town prepares to host Tones And I concert
items.summary: A dedicated community campaign results in the Australian singer performing a one-off, almost sold-out show.

items.title: Three men, one teen charged over gangland attacks linked to 'Coconut Cartel' conflict
items.summary: The group, police allege, have been charged in relation to the shooting of ex-NRL player Matt Utai in Greenacre and a firebombing linked to conflict with the 'Coconut Cartel'.

items.title: Federal authorities target black flights and drug importation in Far North Queensland
items.summary: A joint police taskforce has been launched in Far North Queensland to target the importation of illicit drugs, forced labour and sexual servitude.

items.title: Donald Trump says Andrew's arrest is a 'shame' for Royal family
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Major US fund's credit squeeze could 'blow up' — as it happened
items.summary: Shares in US asset manager Blue Owl have fallen sharply after it announced it was having challenges meeting investors' cash demands.

items.title: Coalition willing to help stop passports for IS-linked women— as it happened
items.summary: Angus Taylor says the Coalition is willing to help the government strengthen legislation so women with ties to Islamic State are not issued Australian passports.

items.title: Amyl and the Sniffers singer in escalating legal battle with photographer
items.summary: What began as a photo shoot with champagne, ice cream and humorous glamour shots of Amy Taylor, singer from punk band Amyl and the Sniffers, has escalated into a legal fight over copyright, the US Constitution and an application for a restraining order.

items.title: Car driving Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor leaves UK police station.
items.summary: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

items.title: Wild horse art on birth certificates is 'hypocritical', says brumby welfare group
items.summary: A limited-edition birth certificate released to mark the Chinese Year of the Horse is being labelled "hypocritical" as a cull of wild horses continues in the NSW high country.

items.title: Can Angus Taylor get beyond slogans to craft a sound immigration policy?
items.summary: The rifts in Australia's social cohesion can be seen in the blow-up over the so-called ISIS brides and their children, who want to come to Australia.

items.title: Study to test whether a new helmet will significantly reduce risk of concussion in football players
items.summary: A lot of research has gone in to treating concussions, but now scientists are testing a new helmet to see if it can prevent them before they happen.

items.title: Youth justice experts warn over-policing of residential care children is 'manufacturing criminals'
items.summary: Experts say over-policing and South Australia's youth criminal justice system is helping turn children in residential care into criminals.

items.title: Voters divided as Barnaby Joyce considers contesting New England for One Nation
items.summary: One Nation MP Barnaby Joyce says he might recontest his seat of New England as a candidate for One Nation if the party needs him to.

items.title: Full list of 11 Australian women with ISIS links trying to leave Syria revealed
items.summary: The ABC can reveal the names of the 11 women connected to former Islamic State fighters in Syria who attempted to journey home to Australia this week.

items.title: The 2026 South Australia election is here — Have your say about what matters to you
items.summary: We want to know what issues matter most to you and what you want us to find out ahead of the March 21, SA election.

items.title: As electric car prices fall, will affordability win over drivers?
items.summary: The price tag of EVs has been a barrier to uptake. As cheaper models hit the market, will more drivers go electric?

items.title: Georgia Voll top scores as Australia beats India in second Twenty20 by 19 runs
items.summary: The retirement of Alyssa Healy leaves a big hole at the top of the order, but Georgia Voll looks capable of stepping in after a career-best outing in Canberra.

items.title: Police say 'hope is fading' in hunt for kidnapped Sydney grandfather
items.summary: Police believe they have found a "stronghold" used by the kidnappers of Chris Baghsarian in Dural as the search for the 85-year-old continues.

items.title: Calls for protection of Tasmania's penguins amid reports of birds 'handled by the neck'
items.summary: Each summer, tourists flock to Tasmanian beaches to marvel at penguins, but for some, admiring the birds from afar is not enough.

items.title: Sisters Lisa and Rachael Maza reunite on stage for the world premiere of Black Light
items.summary: The former head of Indigenous theatre company Ilbijerri teams up with her sister Lisa for the world premiere of Black Light, which tells the story of three generations of Blak women.

items.title: Weekly news quiz: Museum robberies, the Lunar New Year and a new shadow cabinet
items.summary: It has been a huge week in news. Did you catch these stories?

items.title: Man On The Run: How Paul McCartney rebuilt his life after The Beatles
items.summary: Morgan Neville's new documentary is a fascinating portrait of an artist rebuilding himself while the world watches on.

items.title: Former premier joins community calls for speed reduction at 'dangerous' fatal intersection in Newham
items.summary: A community in central Victoria is calling for a 20 kph speed limit reduction at a "terribly dangerous" intersection after four major accidents.

items.title: Ally Hickman showed her grit at 2026 Winter Olympics after heavy fall on second run
items.summary: In a Winter Olympics beset by both glory and injury, Ally Hickman's heavy fall in the snowboard slopestyle could have turned a happy day into another disappointing one. Instead, the young Aussie showed her grit to get back up and go again.

items.title: Michael Brian Becton sentenced to more than 24 years in jail for child sex offences
items.summary: Michael Brian Becton, 33, is handed a 24-and-a-half year prison term after pleading guilty to 77 child sexual offences against children and babies. WARNING: This story contains details that some readers may find distressing.

items.title: Abandoned Antarctic base is now a pollution threat
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

items.title: Have Australian researchers found the secret to treating sepsis?
items.summary: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.
